about.summary: Cairo is a 2D graphics library with support for multiple output devices.

name: cairo
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "1.16.0" %}

package:
  name: cairo
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: http://cairographics.org/releases/cairo-{{ version }}.tar.xz
  sha256: 5e7b29b3f113ef870d1e3ecf8adf21f923396401604bda16d44be45e66052331
  patches:
    - windows_enable_cairo_gobject.patch  # [win]
    - windows_pc_files.patch  # [win]

build:
  number: 1004
  skip: true    # [win and vc<14]
  run_exports:
    - {{ pin_subpackage('cairo') }}

requirements:
  build:
    - posix                 # [win]
    - m2w64-xz              # [win]
    - pkg-config            # [not win]
    - libtool               # [not win]
    - automake              # [not win]
    - make                  # [not win]
    - xz                    # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('c') }}
    - pthread-stubs         # [linux]
    - xcb-proto             # [linux]
    - xorg-renderproto      # [linux]
    - xorg-xproto           # [linux]
  host:
    - freetype              # [not win]
    - fontconfig            # [not win]
    - glib
    - icu
    - libpng
    - libxcb                # [linux]
    - pixman
    - xorg-libice  # [linux]
    - xorg-libsm  # [linux]
    - xorg-libx11  # [linux]
    - xorg-libxext  # [linux]
    - xorg-libxrender  # [linux]
    - zlib
  run:
    - freetype              # [not win]
    - fontconfig            # [not win]
    - glib
    - icu
    - libpng
    - libxcb                # [linux]
    - pixman
    - xorg-libice  # [linux]
    - xorg-libsm  # [linux]
    - xorg-libx11  # [linux]
    - xorg-libxext  # [linux]
    - xorg-libxrender  # [linux]
    - zlib

test:
  commands:
    # Check commands.
    - cairo-trace --help  # [not win]

    # Verify libraries.
    {% set cairo_libs = [
            "libcairo",
            "libcairo-gobject",
            "libcairo-script-interpreter",
    ] %}
    {% for each_cairo_lib in cairo_libs %}
    - test -f $PREFIX/lib/{{ each_cairo_lib }}.a      # [not win]
    - test -f $PREFIX/lib/{{ each_cairo_lib }}.dylib  # [osx]
    - test -f $PREFIX/lib/{{ each_cairo_lib }}.so     # [linux]
    {% endfor %}

    # Check pkg-config files.
    - test -f $PREFIX/lib/pkgconfig/cairo-quartz.pc   # [osx]
    - test -f $PREFIX/lib/pkgconfig/cairo-xlib.pc     # [linux]

    # check include files
    - test -f $PREFIX/include/cairo/cairo.h           # [unix]

    # check that cairo was built with fontconfig support
    - grep -q "CAIRO_HAS_FC_FONT 1" $PREFIX/include/cairo/cairo-features.h  # [unix]

about:
  home: http://cairographics.org/
  dev_url: https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/cairo/cairo
  doc_url: https://www.cairographics.org/documentation/
  license: LGPL 2.1 or MPL 1.1
  license_file: COPYING
  summary: 'Cairo is a 2D graphics library with support for multiple output devices.'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - ccordoba12
    - jakirkham
    - ocefpaf
    - pkgw
smithy_version:
No azure token. Create a token and
put it in ~/.conda-smithy/azure.token
3.7.0
